result.execSummary:
The defendant Torin T Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of supervision.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA and follow through. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Must be compliant with any child support orders. Defendant must submit a DNA specimen, as required by law, and pay for the testing. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Torin T Turner in court with attorney Carl Bradford Johnson.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Parties have received PSI and reviewed same. No additions or corrections noted by parties. Stipulated restitution $1,020.00 to Johnson Bank in 641 and to RH in the amount of $4,741,59 and in exchange for agreeing to pay that restitution, the State agrees not to issue charges listed in RPD report. The State agreed to follow PSI and agrees probation is appropriate. Defense asks for I/S prison and probation. Defense agrees to restitution and asks for 30 days RCJ as a condition of probation with huber for child care and work and 50 hrs community service. Defense also asks that deft be made eligible for expungement if he successfully completes probation.

BTC: 13CF641-Total sentence is 4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES - STAYED. 3 yrs probation
